page.title: 03BLAENSERCHAN COLLIERY
page.content: { Blaenserchan Colliery}was opened in 1893. At one time there were 30 or so mines or levels in{Torfaen. Blaenserchan is now the{last working {mine. }It employs 360 workers. The mine will{close on August 28th.,1985. { }A workforce of between six and ten men will be left to operate the shafts and pumps. They are at present linking Blaenser- chan with{Six Bells Colliery, Aber- {tillery}by digging underground. The miners will be transferred to Abertillery but continue to work the Blaenserchan seams. Blaenserchan will also be used as a {second way out}for the miners of Six Bells Colliery. The colliery produces some{3,000 tons of coal per week which is used at the {Llanwern Steel Works.
